name: Brainstorm Diverge-Converge Quality Rubric

criteria.name: Divergence Quantity
criteria.description: Generated sufficient number of ideas to explore the possibility space

criteria.name: Divergence Variety
criteria.description: Ideas show diversity in approach, scale, and type (not all similar)

scoring.1: All ideas are nearly identical or very similar
scoring.2: Mostly similar ideas with 1-2 different approaches
scoring.3: Mix of similar and different ideas, some variety present
scoring.4: Good variety across multiple dimensions (incremental/radical, short/long-term, etc.)
scoring.5: Exceptional variety - ideas span multiple approaches, scales, mechanisms, and perspectives

criteria.name: Divergence Creativity
criteria.description: Includes both safe/obvious ideas and creative/unconventional ideas

scoring.2: Mostly obvious ideas with 1-2 slightly creative ones
scoring.3: Mix of obvious and creative ideas, some boundary-pushing
scoring.4: Good balance of safe and creative ideas with several unconventional approaches
scoring.5: Exceptional creativity - includes wild ideas that challenge assumptions alongside practical ones

criteria.name: Cluster Quality
criteria.description: Ideas are organized into meaningful, distinct, well-labeled themes

scoring.1: No clustering or random groupings with unclear logic
scoring.2: Poor clustering - significant overlap between clusters or vague labels
scoring.3: Decent clustering - mostly distinct groups with adequate labels
scoring.4: Good clustering - clear distinct themes with descriptive, specific labels
scoring.5: Exceptional clustering - perfectly distinct themes with insightful labels that reveal patterns

criteria.name: Cluster Coverage
criteria.description: Clusters represent meaningfully different approaches (4-8 clusters typical)

scoring.3: 4-8 clusters with some overlap between them
scoring.4: 4-8 clusters that are distinct and well-balanced
scoring.5: 4-8 clusters that are distinct, balanced, and reveal strategic dimensions of the problem

criteria.name: Evaluation Criteria Clarity
criteria.description: Convergence criteria are explicit, relevant, and well-defined

scoring.1: No criteria stated or purely subjective ('better', 'best')
scoring.3: Criteria stated but could be more specific or relevant
scoring.4: Clear, specific, relevant criteria (e.g., impact, feasibility, cost)
scoring.5: Exceptional criteria - specific, relevant, weighted appropriately, with clear definitions

criteria.name: Scoring Rigor
criteria.description: Ideas are scored systematically with justified ratings

scoring.2: Scoring present but inconsistent or unjustified
scoring.4: Systematic scoring with clear justification for ratings
scoring.5: Exceptional scoring - consistent, justified, includes sensitivity analysis or confidence intervals

criteria.name: Selection Quality
criteria.description: Top selections clearly outperform alternatives based on stated criteria

scoring.1: Selections don't match scores or criteria, appear arbitrary
scoring.2: Selections somewhat aligned with scores but weak justification
scoring.3: Selections aligned with scores, basic justification provided
scoring.4: Selections clearly justified based on scores and criteria, tradeoffs noted
scoring.5: Exceptional selections - fully justified with explicit tradeoff analysis and consideration of dependencies

criteria.name: Actionability
criteria.description: Output includes clear next steps and decision-ready recommendations

scoring.1: No next steps or vague 'implement this' statements
scoring.3: Basic next steps with some specific actions
scoring.4: Clear, specific next steps with timelines and owners
scoring.5: Exceptional actionability - detailed implementation plan with milestones, resources, and success metrics

criteria.name: Process Integrity
criteria.description: Follows diverge-cluster-converge sequence without premature filtering

scoring.1: Process violated - filtered during divergence or skipped clustering
scoring.2: Some premature filtering or weak clustering step
scoring.3: Process mostly followed with minor shortcuts
scoring.4: Process followed correctly with clear phase separation
scoring.5: Exceptional process integrity - clear phase separation, no premature judgment, explicit constraints

thresholds.very_good: Average score ≥ 4.0 (most strategic decisions should aim for this)
thresholds.needs_rework: Average score < 3.0 (redo before using for decisions)

stakes_guidance.low_stakes: Exploratory ideation, early brainstorming: aim for ≥ 3.0
stakes_guidance.medium_stakes: Feature prioritization, project selection: aim for ≥ 3.5
stakes_guidance.high_stakes: Strategic initiatives, resource allocation: aim for ≥ 4.0

usage_instructions: Rate each criterion on 1-5 scale. Calculate average. For important decisions, minimum score is 3.5. For high-stakes strategic choices, aim for ≥4.0. Check especially for divergence quantity (at least 20 ideas), cluster quality (distinct themes), and evaluation rigor (explicit criteria with justified scoring).
